My first 'objection'' would be...: were the Tokugawa/Meiji samurai the 
last ones? What about WWII ??

Anyway, I would look in the University video department for J.Mass' 
lecture titled: "1000 Years of the Samurai." It's on video, some 55 
mins, and covers it all.

By the way, I believe many on this list would like to check that out. I 
have it on mpeg, but its like 600MB. maybe I can share it on 
Limewire... Any other idea? It is, indeed, excellent material.
cepo


On Jan 22, 2004, at 4:07 AM, coeli jimenez wrote:

> hi..
>
> i need some help. i am supposed to write an argumentative paper for my 
> language class. my chosen topic is:
>
> Which is better, the "original" samurai (those who started the 
> military class) or the "last" samurai (tokugawa to meiji eras)?
>
> can anybody help me please? i need facts and notes, as well as ideas 
> about the whole thing. i would appreciate it if you can email me 
> personally..
>
> thank you.
>
>
> Coeli
>
